alert.note: Alert for Western Highland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 7:19PM EST until January 10 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of western Maryland, including the following area, Central and Eastern Allegany, western Virginia, including the following areas, Eastern Highland and Western Highland, and eastern West Virginia, including the following areas, Eastern Grant, Eastern Mineral, Eastern Pendleton, Hampshire, Hardy and Western Pendleton. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of creeks and streams as well as urban areas and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A period of moderate to heavy will continue through this evening. Rainfall totals of one to three inches are expected. Any lingering snowpack will increase runoff as it melts. - Please visit weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
